Subjective: Low back pain radiating to right leg/foot x1.5 weeks. Worse with lifting at work. Negatives: No trauma, normal saddle sensation, no bowel/bladder incontinence. Meds: Paracetamol, ibuprofen (max doses, no relief). Social: Works at supermarket (heavy lifting), now on sick leave. ICE: Concerned, wants pain relief to sleep.
Objective: Gait: Antalgic. Spine: No tenderness on palpation. SLR: +ve on right. Sensation: Slightly decreased on lateral right lower leg. Strength 5/5 bilaterally. Reflexes: Normal.
Assessment: Lumbosacral radicular syndrome, susp. HNP. No signs of cauda equina.
Plan: 1. Trial pregabalin (start low, titrate up). 2. No driving while titrating. 3. Physio referral for exercises. 4. F/U: Phone call 1 week for symptom check. 5. Safety net: Contact if saddle anesthesia, incontinence, or weakness develops.
